title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 7-2.4 - Short periods
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 7-2.4 - Short periods

State Regulations
(Tax Law, section 213-a(g))

If a taxpayer is required to make a declaration of
estimated tax pursuant to section
7-2.1
of this Subpart and a short
taxable year is involved, a declaration for the fractional part of the year is
required. No declaration is required if the short taxable year is a period of
five months or less. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
§§
7-2.4

Adopted

New

York State Register December 27, 2023/Volume XLV, Issue 52, eff. 12/27/2023

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
